bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 8, 1898

div1.p: Lazear writes about his vacation on Nantucket Island.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 8, 1898
div1.p:
I had a very
nice ride up on the boat
on Monday night and
reached here at ten
o'clock Tuesday morning.

Mabel and the rest are
all well. The house
here is very attractive.

It is on Nantucket
Sound quite a large body
of water shut off from
the ocean by Nantucket
Island. The island
however is not
visible. There is a
nice beach for bathing.

We have been in every
day. On Tuesday we
had a nice sail on
the sound in a yacht
belonging to an old
gentleman from Philadelphia
who very kindly invited
us to join him.

The country is flat and
very picturesque.

It has however one great drawback,
very vicious mosquitos. The house however
has screen but there is no
comfort it one goes back any
distance from the beach.

Mrs. Houston does not intend to stay
at Jennie's and her idea was
that you and she would board
together. She expects now to go
to Boston about Sept. 19.

Mabel and I are going to Boston on
Monday or Tuesday and after staying
one night go on to New York. If
you could get an inexpensive room
for us at the Bayard we would
like to stop there for a day or two.
Mabel sends her love.

Remember me kindly to Miss Van Vleck.
Thank you very much for the “Times”
